document_title: Pre-Op History & Physical – Pediatric Alport syndrome, admitted for DDKT
Transplant Operative & Immediate Post-Op Note – DDKT (left iliac fossa), CIT 18 h, WIT 32 min
Inpatient Progress Note – POD#1: falling creatinine, immunosuppression and infection prophylaxis initiated
Inpatient Progress Note – POD#3: tacrolimus titration, renal ultrasound normal, discharge planning
Discharge Summary – Post-DDKT hospitalization, home meds and follow-up
Outpatient Clinic – Week 1: labs, tacrolimus adjustment, DSA negative
Outpatient Clinic – Week 2: stable graft function, BK PCR not detected
Outpatient Clinic – Month 1: stent removal, ultrasound normal, DSA negative
Outpatient Clinic – Month 2: tremor and high trough, dose reduced; low-level BK viremia
Outpatient Clinic – Month 3: rising BK viremia, MMF reduction, DSA negative
Outpatient Clinic – Month 4: BK suppressed, stable function, vaccinations and ongoing prophylaxis
